channel.title: eXtensions - Macs in Bangkok
channel.itunes:author: Graham K. Rogers
channel.description: eXtensions based on the Cassandra Column (AMITIAE), with additional comments and news
channel.itunes:subtitle: eXtensions Macintosh and OS X in Bangkok
channel.itunes:summary: eXtensions based on the Cassandra Column (AMITIAE), with additional comments and news

item.title: eXtensions - Macs in Bangkok - Cassandra on AMITIAE
item.itunes:author: Graham K. Rogers
item.description: Rumours and patents which are always with us as news concerning Apple. A Kentucky school district buys 2,200 Macs; while a US council buys iPads to cut paper use. Comments on Lion, good and not so good. And a couple of items of local interest.
item.itunes:subtitle: Rumours and patents which are always with us as news concerning Apple. A Kentucky school district buys 2,200 Macs; while a US council buys iPads to cut paper use. Comments on Lion, good and not so good. And a couple of items of local interest.

item.itunes:keywords: Thailand, OS X, Macintosh, Macs, Apple, Bangkok Post, Database, Graham Rogers, Mahidol, Engineering

item.title: eXtensions - Macs in Bangkok - Cassandra on AMITIAE
item.itunes:author: Graham K. Rogers
item.description: The arrival of Lion and as I said last week, It's just magic of course. Apple had a busy week after its financial results report p- itself a record -- with a release of Lion, the new MacBook Air, a new Mac mini and a new Thunderbolt connected 27″ Cinema Display; and some software updates too.
item.itunes:subtitle: The arrival of Lion and as I said last week, It's just magic of course. Apple had a busy week after its financial results report p- itself a record -- with a release of Lion, the new MacBook Air, a new Mac mini and a new Thunderbolt connected 27″ Cinema Display; and some software updates too.

item.title: eXtensions - Macs in Bangkok - Cassandra on AMITIAE
item.itunes:author: Graham K. Rogers
item.description: The non-arrival of Lion its just magic. Apple sales successes. More on legal cases. Apple pricing and deals for enterprise. Macs are expensive? Try the latest Sony Vaio. News Corp under attack and floundering in the UK and US. It is a public holiday here in Thailand and a long weekend for many.

item.title: eXtensions - Macs in Bangkok AMITIAE Podcast
item.itunes:author: Graham K. Rogers
item.description: This week there was slow start with the US Independence Day holiday which had a knock-on effect in some places, but not the UK. Samsung was the loser all round getting hit by Apple, by Microsoft and reporting considerably lower profits a company ripe for takeover perhaps. Has Apple been censoring at Mobile Me? News on possible future iPhones and iPads. Nokia cuts the price of some of its phones. Bangkok Post increases the price of epaper subscriptions. Some looking forward to next weeks expected Lion release. And the death of a newspaper in the UK remorse or PR from News International?
item.itunes:subtitle: This week there was slow start with the US Independence Day holiday which had a knock-on effect in some places, but not the UK. item.title: eXtensions - Macs in Bangkok - AMITIAE podcast
item.itunes:author: Graham K. Rogers
item.description: More on Final Cut Pro X with Adobe seizing a possible opportunity. Lion next week? Apple and Samsung an imminent divorce. HP Touchpad reported as mediocre. 4 years of iPhones and 4 years of wrong quotes. RIM anonymous letters and a committee to solve all their problems.
item.itunes:subtitle: More on Final Cut Pro X with Adobe seizing a possible opportunity. Lion next week? Apple and Samsung an imminent divorce. HP Touchpad reported as mediocre. 4 years of iPhones and 4 years of wrong quotes. RIM anonymous letters and a committee to solve all their problems.

item.title: eXtensions - Macs in Bangkok - Cassandra on AMITIAE
item.itunes:author: Graham K. Rogers
item.description: The OS X update has finally arrived 10.6.8 is available now. Lots of patent news this time, as well as related lawsuits some you win, some you lose. More too on RIMs fading star who will snap them up? Rumours on the iPhone 5 especially on the camera, flash (small F) and the A5 processor. A Google antitrust inquiry. That clumsy FBI raid that has damaged a number of businesses including Instapaper.
item.itunes:subtitle: The OS X update has finally arrived 10.6.8 is available now. Lots of patent news this time, as well as related lawsuits some you win, some you lose. item.title: eXtensions - Macs in Bangkok - Cassandra 2
item.itunes:author: Graham K. Rogers
item.description: The developer who released common pass-codes has the app removed from the App Store. Dates for WWDC next year. Dangers of PR utterances. Apple and past events. Apple sued for using the iBooks name. RIM over the edge. And lots more.
item.itunes:subtitle: The developer who released common pass-codes has the app removed from the App Store. Dates for WWDC next year. Dangers of PR utterances. Apple and past events. Apple sued for using the iBooks name. RIM over the edge. And lots more.

item.title: eXtensions Podcasts from AMITIAE - Cassandra Friday 11 June 2011
item.itunes:author: Graham K. Rogers
item.description: After much persuasion, it seemed like a reasonable idea to try the podcast format again. The Cassandra Friday column has a lot more news on Apple's WWDC 2011 with background to iOS 5, OS X 10.7, Lion and other items. We also look at the other dabblers in the market like Nokia, Android and such but welcome the new HP TouchPad with webOS

item.itunes:author: Graham K. Rogers
item.description: The final eXtensions podcast on hardware and software used in Singapore on a trip down there. Plus comments on the iPad and its catalytical effect, as well as other news, comments and ideas.

item.title: eXtensions - Macs in Bangkok - #279
item.itunes:author: Graham K. Rogers
item.description: The third and final part of my brief look at iLife '11, with some comments on GarageBand and iMovie. We also look at the iOS4.2 update and related topics of iPad, iPhone and apps, as well as the direction of online news sources, plus some comments on the TSA scanners.
item.itunes:subtitle: The third and final part of my brief look at iLife '11, with some comments on GarageBand and iMovie. We also look at the iOS4.2 update and related topics of iPad, iPhone and apps, as well as the direction of online news sources, plus some comments on the TSA scanners.
